description: 100 multiple-choice questions derived from conceptual content of the WCBA-OBTY Slides (ignores exercises, knowledge checks, and options references).

questions.text: What are Windchill objects stored as?
Where do you find detailed information about a Windchill object?
Which utility manages object types, subtypes, layouts, and attributes?
Which display name corresponds to Java class wt.part.WTPart?
Which display name maps to wt.doc.WTDocument?
Which Java class represents CAD Documents?
Which change object class represents a Change Notice?
Which object type acts as the parent of all objects?
Which object type is highlighted as the common example in this course?
Who can modify the layout of object Information pages?
What does subtyping do in Windchill?
options: Creates a new type based on an existing parent type

questions.text: Which two reasons are given for extending a type?
options: Add attributes and create custom layouts

questions.text: Where do subtypes created in an Organization context remain?
What do layouts control for a type or subtype?
options: Which attributes are displayed and where

questions.text: What does layout inheritance mean for a subtype?
options: A subtype automatically inherits the parent type's layouts

questions.text: Which feature enables values to be shown in a user's language?
Which icon indicates a value can be localized?
options: The localize icon next to the value field

questions.text: If the browser locale has no installed language match, which locale is assumed?
Which utility manages a type’s properties, attributes, layouts, and relationship constraints?
Which statement about duplicate and extend OOTB types is correct?
options: You can duplicate and extend out-of-the-box types without coding

questions.text: How many attribute categories are highlighted in the course?
Which attribute type can be used by more than one parent type and is stored separately?
Which attribute type can only be used by one type and is stored in columns of the object class?
Which attribute type is derived using formulas from existing attributes?
Which attribute maps information from a related object via navigation operators?
Which attribute type is programmed in Java and not created in the Type and Attribute utility?
Which workflow steps are listed for adding an attribute?
options: Enter Edit Mode, Add Type, Set Name, Set Properties

questions.text: What object areas can you manage to configure types and subtypes?
options: Create types, add attributes, edit layouts, set constraints
Backup vaults, reset caches, reindex site
Set firewall, manage emails, style UI
Edit databases, modify JVM, change OS

questions.text: Which visibility settings can be applied per screen to attributes?
options: Admin Only, Team Only, Guest Only

questions.text: What do global enumerations provide?
options: Reusable selection lists stored independently and applicable to several types

questions.text: Where are global enumerations organized?
options: Under organizers below the Root node

questions.text: Which measurement systems does Windchill support for attributes?
What does 'Quantities of Measure' indicate in Windchill?
options: Support for over 40 standard quantities of measure
Measures limited to length and mass

questions.text: Which are examples of string-related constraints?
Which constraints can require values or restrict multiplicity?
What does a 'Legal or Suggested Value' constraint do?
options: Defines a set of unique or suggested values bound to the type

questions.text: What is an 'External Enumerated Value List' constraint?
options: Retrieves legal values from another system via custom code

questions.text: Which constraint type is modeled in Java and used for states or roles?
Give an example of a constraint preventing invalid numeric attributes.
options: Valid Range preventing negative mass or length

questions.text: What is a 'Legal Type List' constraint for?
options: Restricting allowed related types or classifications

questions.text: What do cascading attributes rules accomplish?
options: Drive values of one attribute based on another

questions.text: Where are attribute constraints shown on a type?
options: In the attribute’s Constraints section of the type

questions.text: What are typical visibility settings for the 'Context' attribute?
options: Read/Write in Create New; Hidden in Edit (example)

questions.text: Which best practice aids readability and collaboration for datum/attribute names?
options: Rename features and attributes to meaningful names

questions.text: Which behaviors can Object Initialization Rules control?
options: Numbering, versioning, folder path, life cycle, team template
GPU settings, JVM heap, OS threads
Printer setup, email routing, theme colors

questions.text: In what format are OIRs written?
Where are OIRs available for configuration?
What can OIR management tables show at an Organization context?
options: Rules from both the Site and the Organization

questions.text: Which rule associates a life cycle and team template to new objects?
What does a versioning scheme rule define?
options: The labels applied to newly-created object revisions

questions.text: What is the default out-of-the-box version series used in examples?
Which versioning scheme moves from A.1 to B.1?
Which versioning scheme uses numbers like 1.1 then 2.1?
Which example shows a state-based transition?
What does a File-Based versioning scheme rely on?
options: An uploaded XML file defining series values

questions.text: Which Arg value references a file-based series name?
What does an Arg value of wt.series.HarvardSeries.StateBased indicate?
What is a best practice for editing new OIRs?
options: Start from OOTB XML documents and set only what you need
Edit at Site for all cases

questions.text: Which components are included in an out-of-the-box numbering rule example?
options: User theme, ACL mask, report job
Digits, default folder, life cycle state, version series, team template
Workflow name, role mapping, icon set

questions.text: Which example shows OOTB numbering for WTDocument?
options: Manual number, /Root, Released, Numeric-only, Custom team
10-digit number, /Default folder, Basic life cycle (In Work), Harvard series A.1, Default team
Alpha string, /Library, Obsolete, MILSTD, Any team

questions.text: Which series can be configured from Life Cycle Administrator's Version Series menu?
Which example Arg sets a custom file-based series?
What is the maximum value for Standard Integer per note?
Which transitions are driven by Revise and Check Out/Check In?
options: Revision and iteration (e.g., A.1 → A.2 → B.1)

questions.text: Why use global enumerations for attributes?
options: Maintain sets of values independent of constraints and reuse across types
Tie values to a single type only

questions.text: Which graphical attribute maps state-based values to colors?
Which graphical attribute displays percent complete on 0–100 range?
Which graphical attribute can display arbitrary ranges with a percentage tooltip?
What data types are required for cascading rules in the If–Then example?
What do the rules 'If' and 'And If' drive in cascading attributes?
options: The value of the Then attribute

questions.text: In the example, if Locale = Italy, which Facility value is driven?
What scope do initialization rules apply to?
options: Object-class specific and can manage all subtypes of a rule

questions.text: At which contexts can you view OIR tables?
options: Site and Organization (shown together in org view)

questions.text: Which items are listed under 'Rules Impact These Attributes'?
options: Email server, printer queue, font set
Numbering, versioning, folder path, life cycle, team template

questions.text: Which layout capability allows attribute grouping on Information pages?
Which object types table shows Display Name versus Java Class Name?
Which constraint can enforce uppercase or lowercase entry?
Which constraint ensures strings match a pattern?
Which constraint marks an attribute as immutable?
Which visibility option lets users see an attribute exists but not its value?
Which attribute list is maintained independent of a specific constraint?
Which management step completes attribute creation after setting properties?
Which attribute types can display values as graphics like lights or bars?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 84)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 85)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 86)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 87)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 88)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 89)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 90)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 91)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 92)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 93)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 94)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 95)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 96)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 97)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 98)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 99)?
Which Windchill capability is configured via XML in Object Initialization Rules (item 100)?
